SEARCH
Module PacMan
Package scripts

Class Character

java.lang.Object
scripts.Character
All Implemented Interfaces:
CharacterActions
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ghost, PacMan
public abstract class Character extends Object implements CharacterActions
This abstract class serves as the base model for creating the two character types in the game: PacMan and Ghost. It defines their shared attributes, such as starting position, current position, and current movement direction.

The class also provides most of the getter and setter methods used by both character types, ensuring consistent behavior across all game entities.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Davide Di Stefano
See Also:
  • for the ghost implementation
  • for the Pac-Man implementation

    The initial (x, y) coordinates where the character spawns at the start of the game.

  • Field Details

    • currentCoordinatesXY

      protected int[] currentCoordinatesXY
      The current (x, y) coordinates of the character on the game board.

    • startingCoordinatesXY

      protected int[] startingCoordinatesXY
      The initial (x, y) coordinates where the character spawns at the start of the game. This value is used to reset the character to its default position.

    • currentDirectionXY

      protected int[] currentDirectionXY
      The current movement direction of the character, represented as a vector (x, y).

  • Constructor Details

    • Character

      public Character(int[] currentCoordinatesXY, int[] currentDirectionXY)
      Constructs a new Character instance, used as the base model for both PacMan and Ghost. It initializes the starting position, current position, and movement direction of the character.
      Parameters:
      currentCoordinatesXY - the current coordinates of the character (x, y); this value is also used to initialize startingCoordinatesXY, which stores the default spawn position.
      currentDirectionXY - the initial movement direction of the character (x, y).

  • Method Details

    • setCoordinatesXY

      public void setCoordinatesXY(int[] newCoordinatesXY)
      Updates the current coordinates of the character.
      Parameters:
      newCoordinatesXY - an array representing the new (x, y) coordinates.

    • getCoordinatesXY

      public int[] getCoordinatesXY()
      Retrieves the current position of the character.
      Returns:
      an integer array representing the current (x, y) coordinates.

    • getDefaultCoordinatesXY

      public int[] getDefaultCoordinatesXY()
      Retrieves the initial spawn position of the character.
      Returns:
      an integer array containing the default (x, y) coordinates.

    • updateDirection

      public void updateDirection(int[] inputDirectionXY)
      Updates the movement direction of the character.
      Parameters:
      inputDirectionXY - an integer array representing the new direction vector (x, y).

    • getcurrentDirectionXY

      public int[] getcurrentDirectionXY()
      Retrieves the current movement direction of the character.
      Returns:
      an integer array representing the current direction (x, y).
